intro: Platantheroides heleogena, commonly known as the yellow twayblade, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. It has a short rhizome and lacks true leaves, relying on its photosynthetic stems for energy. Platantheroides heleogena is a specialist orchid that requires specific ecological conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
